title: Development of Teaching Strategies for Kindergarten Group Sizes and Learning Environment Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Educational Psychology and Fundamental Understanding of Early Childhood Education Environment Design
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented education using smartphone-based VR simulations in limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Three or more kindergarten group formation strategies utilizing intentional/unintentional learning approaches can be designed
Design plans for early childhood learning environments can be proposed by applying Bronfenbrenner’s ecological systems theory
Teacher roles can be practiced in various group-size scenarios through VR simulations, and improvement strategies can be derived

resources: Early Childhood Education Environment Case Database
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
